intro: Cybistax coriacea, commonly known as the rough-leaved hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its rough, textured leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Cybistax coriacea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
